instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-01700 20v 0.03a
threads.message:
no water damage.
PPBUS 12.2V
no voltage at  SLPS2R or AWAKE

threads.title: 820-01700 20v 0.03a
threads.message:
Be sure to use original 96/140W charger.
Check PMIC LDOs, page 76.
If no good, check R7900.

threads.title: 820-01700 20v 0.03a
threads.message: before i check this..one side of both usb-c not working..

threads.title: 820-01700 20v 0.03a
threads.message: and now the charger without battery give 5v 0.1a

threads.title: 820-01700 20v 0.03a
threads.message:
Still no voltage on the small coils around to PMIC?
Compare their dioe mode readings with good board.
May need to change U7800, or T2 is bad.

threads.title: 820-01700 20v 0.03a
threads.message: i was replaced u3100/200 now i have 20v 0a on all 4 ports and still not enter to DFU

threads.title: 820-01700 20v 0.03a
threads.message:
Did you use the correct dfu port?
Try another cable too.
96W original charger for sure?

You can try forcing SWK003.

threads.title: 820-01700 20v 0.03a
threads.message:
not working..
with battery its 20v 0a
without is 5v 0.5a

threads.title: 820-01700 20v 0.03a
threads.message: You are doing something wrong, or board is trash...

threads.title: 820-01700 20v 0.03a
threads.message: maybe im not force SWK003 correct...how do i do it?

threads.title: 820-01700 20v 0.03a
threads.message:
o.k i was try that but still the same..
i was also do rechecking of SLPS2R/AWAKE and pp1v8_awake was full short, i was injunct 1v on him and the short gone but i didnt see from where, now i have 1.8v on PP1V8_AWAKE but still the same

threads.title: 820-01700 20v 0.03a
threads.message:
Possibly a filter cap with partial short.
But no DFU can be explained by T2 internal damage.

Just in case, reflash U4770 and try again DFU.

threads.title: 820-01700 20v 0.03a
threads.message: didnt work....BUT! PP3V3_G3H_RTC_X 0.0357 on diode mode

threads.title: 820-01700 20v 0.03a
threads.message: i think it just because i plug the charger before..🤦‍♂️

threads.title: 820-01700 20v 0.03a
threads.message: Always allow 10-15s after remove the power from the board, before checking in diode mode, or ohm scale.
